record.description: These nine young men are the brightest at the University of Chicago, as determined by their scores in scholastic aptitude tests. Left to right: Mark Ashin, Robert Jones, Henry Kaplan, Robert Kyhl, Frank Kahn, Herbert Pomerance, Frank Evans, James Bly, and Robert Brumbaugh. Robert Kyhl had the highest average, 349. At Chicago the average for the tests is 232, and at other universities, 170.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
